ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This class provided me with an insight into Hindi conversation, reading, culture, writing, and comprehension. I developed skills in all of these areas, as well as presentation skills through the presentation assignments we were given throughout the semester.
I learnt about a range of texts in Hindi, and how to discuss multiple topics relating to Indian culture, as well as world issues, in the language.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
This class' greatest strength is undoubtedly the Professor, Professor Sharma. She is a constant support and a very caring and fascinating teacher.

The class size is also small, so it is a very nice space to develop language skills without having to feel embarrassed. HNDI 150 helps you develop all areas of the language and I would most definitely take it again.
The course has students at varying levels of proficiency, so the content covered was very diverse. The course content was also designed based on the interests of students, making it engaging.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this course to any interested student. Because of the small class size you become great friends with your classmates. It is also a very good space to practice your skills in. The Professor is brilliant and I left this semester with an increased understanding of concepts beyond just Hindi, but also what we discussed in the language.
Yes, this is a great way to fulfil a language requirement, and the course is both educational and enjoyable.
